definitions: Forced (an unwelcome decision or arrangement) on someone.
Inflicted (something unwelcome or onerous) on someone or something.
Placed (a restriction or duty) on someone or something.
Required (a duty, tax, or penalty) to be paid or done.
examples: The council imposed a ban on parking.
The new tax was imposed on all citizens.
He felt that an unfair burden had been imposed on him.
The judge imposed a heavy fine.
